Updates to clarify decline in fund due to capital gains distribution

** A large mutual fund managed by T. Rowe Price Group Inc TROW.O that is heavily invested in big tech stocks distributed a big capital gains to shareholders this week, resulting in a 10% decline in the fund's net asset value on Tuesday

** When dividends and distributions are paid, the share price of a mutual fund declines by the amount of the per share distribution to shareholders.

** The Blue Chip Growth Fund TRBCX.O at T Rowe, one of the largest U.S. mutual fund companies, is 45% invested in five U.S. megacaps, or almost double the weighting of those companies in the S&P 500 index .SPX

** The five companies are Microsoft Corp MSFT.O, Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O, Google parent Alphabet Inc GOOGL.O, Apple Inc AAPL.O and Facebook owner Meta Platforms FB.O

** According to T Rowe's website, Blue Chip Growth has underperformed the S&P 500 this year, but over the past three- , five- and 10-years it has outperformed the benchmark by three percentage points or more annually for each period


(Reporting by Herbert Lash)
